title: Building a MEAN Stack PWA
subtitle: A Journey into Full-Stack Development with MongoDB, Express, Angular, and Node.js
author: Ankush Agrawal

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: I started this project to build a Progressive Web App for indianolympicdream.com, a platform to inspire Olympic dreams. The tech stack includes MongoDB for the database, Express.js and Node.js for the backend, and Angular for the frontend, all hosted on a Raspberry Pi with Cloudflare Tunnel for secure access.

sections.heading: Challenges
sections.content: One major issue was Content Security Policy (CSP) errors due to inline styles. I resolved this by configuring CSP in Nginx and disabling Cloudflare’s automatic CSP settings.

sections.heading: Implementation
sections.content: The app uses Docker containers for MongoDB, Express.js, and Nginx, ensuring scalability and easy deployment on the Pi.

conclusion: This project taught me the intricacies of full-stack development and the importance of security configurations like CSP. The PWA is now live and performing well!

title: Deploying a Static Tech Blog on GitHub Pages
subtitle: A Step-by-Step Guide to Building a Blog with React and Giscus
author: Ankush Agrawal

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this post, I’ll walk you through setting up a tech blog using React, hosting it on GitHub Pages, and adding comments with Giscus, an open-source solution leveraging GitHub Discussions.

sections.heading: Setup
sections.content: The setup involves creating a React app, adding routes with React Router, and styling with Tailwind CSS.

sections.heading: Deployment
sections.content: We deploy the blog to the gh-pages branch of the agrawalankush repository, ensuring the main branch keeps the source code and README.md.

conclusion: This blog setup is minimal, performant, and easy to maintain, making it a great choice for tech enthusiasts looking to share their projects.
